comment: I really enjoyed the flavor of this. Very unique finish.

Different, but delicious. Not worth the $100 price tag. 
Rating: 4.0

Blood Oath
Pact No. 3
2/4/2017
Classification: Whiskey (Kentucky Straight Bourbon with Secondary Maturation in Cabernet Sauvignon Barrels)
Proof: 98.6 (49.3%)
Age: NAS
Mashbill: Undisclosed
Distillery: Sourced
Bottled: Luxco, River City Distilled Products, St. Louis, Mo
Price: $100
Color: Dark Amber/Medium Copper
Nose: Leather, Vanilla, Brown Sugar, Hint of Oak, Blackberry
Palate: Sweet, Warm, Rich, Smooth, Vanilla, Creamy Caramel, Background fruitiness similar to dark grape
Finish: Medium-Long, Warm, Oak, Clove, Dry 
Personal Rating: 7.25/1
Notes: Altogether I enjoyed this pour as it tastes like a solid traditional bourbon to me...just with a little extra fruitiness added. The palate was especially enjoyable for me as I said, the tradition flavors of vanilla and caramel are sitting on top of this secret little dark berry/grape taste. Going into the finish it immediately brought Welch’s Grape Juice to mind. This is a good sipping bourbon so drink it neat. Or if you like it chilled, some whiskey stones or a single ice cube. I’ve heard of some people paying as much as $200 for a bottle, if that is the case, maybe pass it up, but if you find it for the MSRP of $99, you won’t be mad about adding it to your shelf

$99

This was a very well balanced bourbon. One out the best I've had, sweet, spicy and oak nose. Rich palate that's mellow and smooth with a nice finish as well. Definitely buy IMO, great one for the collection.

Purchased for $99.99 at TW.
Fantastic example of a wine finished bourbon. By far my favorite wine finished bourbon and knocks the socks off any of the Jefferson wine finished products.
It also just might be the smoothest bourbon at this price point. Great box and bottle as well.
Great high rye bourbon smooth with spices and caramel. A rye drinker’s bourbon.

Complex wood and smoke.  Hints of the Cabernet barrels give it a bit of wine flavor. Good mouthfeel, and pretty smooth for the strength. If left at full strength, has a slight bite at the end.

A few drops of water diminishes the wine flavor, and seems to increase the bite slightly. But also seems to Mel's the flavors a bit more.

Overall, would still sip it neat.
Irish, smooth, can’t really remember but liked it (must start rating while tasting!)

sweet and warm
cherry flavor
vanilla after taste
smooth

Initially when I opened this up a couple of months ago I got a similar experience many seem to have encountered with this bourbon: very, very weak nose, but the palate and finish were still speaking to me. Now that it's been given some time to oxidize after a few pours it's definitely "opened up."

Nose: The classic bourbon players are all here; vanilla, brown sugar, a little oak politely in the background. But the cabernet sauvignon finished bourbon (1 of 3 in this blend) adds a gentle pop of raspberry and other red fruit that plays nicely with everyone else. 

Palate: Rich and oily, 49.3% ABV is good for this, but I wouldn't mind if it was bumped up either. On the front end it's classic bourbon again: vanilla, brown sugar, some light tingling of cinnamon. The back end is oak, but it's pleasant and doesn't verge on being too bitter or overdone.

Finish: Gentle, medium length, and warming. A brief flash of vanilla and cinnamon that slowly fades down into oak and light clove. It lingers nicely and surprisingly sits in the chest after swallowing.

Overall I'd say it's successful as a cab finished bourbon; it offers something new without changing the overall experience too much. It honestly hovers around 3.75 to 4 for me; I'm not mad about paying 100 dollars for the bottle now that it's opened up given that I like new experiences and enjoy wine every now and again. If you enjoy both, have the money and want to give it a shot I'd say go for it. If you're on the fence or haven't enjoyed wine finished bourbon in the past, have a pour at the bar but make sure the bottle has been opened quite a bit.
Cigar lounge in Milwaukee - good stuff
Nice rye-forward bourbon with vanilla and red fruit.  Spicy with an alcohol bite.

Definitely let this one open up for a bit. The flavors need a little time in the glass to really stand out.. Caramel, vanilla, strong florals, and black pepper (from the cab casks I presume) on the nose. Spicy rye with a hint of sweet caramel and apricot to taste and goes down really smooth.
A bit overpriced for what it is but a solid, fruit forward sipper nonetheless. The surprise winner of several blind taste tests at my home.
Sweet with subtle notes of the cabernet wine coming through.  In my opinion, it is a must try!

Early on a lot of oak, opened up and was very nice.. reminded me of blanton’s for some reason.
Will look for it

N: Sweet caramel and herbal bouquet with a hint of Mexican spice 
P: Red fruit, creamy vanilla and a hint of spice
F: Lingering oakyness but not much of anything remarkable. Missing that cab finish
Orange Vanilla oaky. Hint of coffee. Good bourbon.
Neat at a bar.  Very tasty
Wonderfully smooth with just that hint of cab cask.  Definitely worth the taste.
